Bhaskar Mookerji home

I'm currenty working on web information retrieval and search quality at Discovery Engine in San Francisco, CA.

I'm on leave from the PhD program at the MIT Department of Mechanical Engineering, where I studied novel optical devices, nanotechnology, and systems for large-scale numerical simulation. I received SBs (Physics, 2009; EECS, 2011) and an MEng (EECS, 2011) from MIT, created algorithms and software for emerging hardware platforms at Apple and Raytheon BBN Technologies, and was the technical director of an artificial vision-based robotics contest. Prior to 2012, I designed protocols and built optical sources for quantum communication at the MIT Research Lab for Electronics.

If you're interested in self-hosting a static webpage, you can read about the details here. The layout itself is based entirely on Tom Preston-Warner's homepage.
